full_text: The fleegle heel is an easy-to-knit top-down heel and is shaped by increases in the shaft, before the stitches are worked under the heel using German short rows to form a triangular cap. In this tutorial, we describe step by step how to knit the increase heel in different variants – with addiCraSyTrio, double pointed needles or circular needles with a magic loop. with sock chart step-by-step for 4-ply, 6-ply and 8-ply sock yarn for DPN, addiCraSyTrio/ FlexiFlips and magic loop The increasing heel is an easy-to-knit top-down heel and is formed by increasing in the shaft before the stitches under the heel are worked into a triangular cap using shortened rows. In these instructions we describe step by step how the increasing heel is knitted in different variations - with addiCraSyTrio, double pointed needles or circular knitting needles with a miracle loop. With sock chart step-by-step For 4-ply, 6-ply and 8-ply sock yarn For needle games, addiCraSyTrio and Magic Loop
